dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1370 IH: Unobligated Spending Adjustment to Focus Investment on Relief and Support for Taxpayers Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Brecheen (for himself, Mr. Norman, and Mr. Donalds) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Appropriations

form.official-title: To transfer unobligated funds from the United States Agency for International Development to the Disaster Relief Fund.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Unobligated Spending Adjustment to Focus Investment on Relief and Support for Taxpayers Act or the USA FIRST Act.

section.header: Transfer of unobligated funds to the disaster relief fund

subsection.text: Any unobligated covered funds shall be transferred to the Disaster Relief Fund to carry out the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5121 et seq.) with respect to major disasters declared under section 401 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5170).
In this section, the term “covered funds” means any unobligated funds previously appropriated to the United States Agency for International Development, as of the date of enactment of this Act.
